node.title: The NT COVID outbreak has gotten 'even stranger' and could be silently spreading. Here are the new testing rules
node.alt: A line of cars queued up along a road outside of a COVID-19 testing site in Katherine.
node.description: Chief Minister Michael Gunner says there's a "a very real possibility" there are people with COVID in the NTÂ who don't know it, as authorities bring in new testing rules to get to the bottom of the latest cluster.
node.content:
["With two new cases confirmed today, the COVID outbreak in the Northern Territory is currently standing at 25.", "A key piece of the puzzle emerged late on Thursday, when it was confirmed that the cases recorded in the small community of Robinson River and Katherine this week are linked to the Darwin/Katherine outbreak from nine days ago.", "But the genomic testing that confirms that link doesn't explain when or how the transmission occurred.", "\"In a sense, that just makes this mystery even stranger because we still don't know how it went from that small first cluster to no cases for nine days,\" NT Chief Minister Michael Gunner said.", "That means there is \"a very real possibility\" there are people with COVID in Katherine who don't know it, Mr Gunner said.", "Here are the new testing rules announced today.", "
New testing rules now in place
", "People currently displaying symptoms of COVID-19 have always been urged to get tested, as have\u00a0close or casual contacts or anyone who has\u00a0visited an\u00a0exposure site.", "But from Friday, anyone\u00a0who has\u00a0shown symptoms at any time in the past few weeks is being asked to get checked.", "Also, anyone who has\u00a0already been tested as part of the current cluster, or who is a close or casual contact, or who has visited an exposure site,\u00a0is being asked to get\u00a0re-tested,\u00a0regardless of whether\u00a0they're showing symptoms.", "", "
Katherine is the focus of the new COVID-19 testing blitz.(ABC News: Michael Franchi)
", "\"We know that people can test negative for Delta initially, only for it to pop up a few days later,\" Mr Gunner said.", "\"In fact, one of the first cases in this second cluster had that happen to him \u2014\u00a0it was his second test that discovered the infection.\u201d", "Mr Gunner said household contacts of anyone who falls into the above categories should also get tested.", "\"I know the lines are long, I'm sorry about that,\u201d he said.", "
Testing to get underway in Binjari
", "Authorities are also focused on testing in Binjari, an Aboriginal community of about 200 people on the outskirts of Katherine.", "A wastewater sample in the community came back\u00a0positive for COVID late on Thursday.", "A\u00a0\"rapid assessment team\" has been deployed to test and vaccinate residents, with support from the\u00a0Katherine-based\u00a0Wurli Wurlinjang Aboriginal Health Service.", "\"It is our intention to test every single person in the Binjari community today,\" Mr Gunner said on Friday.", "\"And we will also get more people vaccinated there today.\"", "
NLC demands expansion of rapid antigen tests
", "From today, anyone who travels from a major urban centre to a remote\u00a0community with a first-dose\u00a0vaccination rate of less than 70 per cent must\u00a0get a rapid antigen test 72 hours before travelling\u00a0and return a negative result.", "But the Northern Land Council said the rule should be expanded to include any remote community, not just those with low vaccination rates.", "\"We want you to do a rapid antigen test regardless of the vaccination rate because we want to do everything we can to protect our communities,\" NLC chairman\u00a0Samuel Bush-Blanasi said.", "\"Wait until you get that negative result before you travel.\"", "The NLC\u00a0is also urging all Territorians to stop travel to or from Aboriginal communities \"unless it is absolutely necessary\", to prevent the spread of COVID-19 to other communities.\u00a0", "", "
COVID cases surging across several European countries
"]
